title: What English words just look like they're spelled wrong? - Quora

response.answer_text: What English words just look like they're spelled wrong? Syzygy looks as though somebody sneezed on the page. It refers to three astronomical bodies (e.g. earth, moon, sun) in a straight line. Chthonic should be pronounced with care. People have been known to lose their dentures while saying it. It refers to the underworld; for instance, chthonic gods, or monsters, or serpents. Kakistocracy sounds like somebody trying to eject a fish-bone from their throat. It’s a real word describing a government by the least capable, least reputable individuals. Hi, Donny. 👹 Then, there’s mnemonic which definitely looks weird but I forget what it means.

Supersede — Always looks as if it should be spelled supercede. Mnemonic — Often mispronounced sounding like ‘pneumonic’. +Many words beginning with ‘psy-’ Indict — sounds ‘indite’ (especially in light of ‘interdict’ pronunciation) Playwright — Because he writes plays we think it should be playwrite. Solemn, condemn, autumn et al — why the ’n’ ending? There are hundreds more.
